title.narrative: Pacific NDC Hub

description.narrative:
PAC06 is the project code for the second phase of the Pacific NDC Hub. (The first phase was under PR1-E1.)
GGGI is a delivery partner of the Pacific NDC Hub. The NDC Hub supports Pacific Island Country States (PICS) to enhance and successfully implement their NDCs: - The first phase of the Pacific NDC Hub started in October 2019 and ended in March 2020 (project code: PR1-E1). - The second phase started in April 2020 and will end in November 2021 (this project code: PAC06).
The NDC Hub provides supports to PICS: - For NDC Enhancement or MRV systems establishment or enhancement; - To prepare NDC Investment Roadmaps, NDC Investment Plans and NDC project pipelines. - It also provides trainings and knowledge sharing through guides and a monthly newsletter.

PAC06 is the project code for the second phase of the Pacific NDC Hub. It supports Pacific Island Country States (PICS) to enhance and successfully implement their NDCs. To do so it provides a large range of services to its Country members to review and enhance their NDCs, implement their NDCs and generate and share knowledge in the Pacific.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04523 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Fiji: Support the Development of the MRV Systems in the Transport Sector.

description.narrative: 1. A blueprint for the MRV system of the Transport Sector developed 2. MRV system guidance and reporting templates 3. National systems guidelines manual for the Transport sector 4. Develop a Quality Control and Quality Assurance Plan for the Transport Sector GHG Inventory development process. 5. Training material and and delivery of support 6. Internal monthly and quarterly reporting

title.narrative: Number of completed advisory outputs that inform the development of government green growth policies.
Our activities in the Hub will: i) enable more efficient use of energy, more renewable energy projects and low carbon mobility solutions
ii) increase cooperation and awareness of low-carbon solutions
iii) improve the skills, tools and processes to track mitigation progress – leading to GHG emission reduction.

description.narrative: Countries will implement new low-carbon projects & use MRV processes to report them

title.narrative: GHG emissions reduction from business as usual (MtCO2e)

Promote knowledge sharing among Pacific Island Countries with a monthly newsletter, training workshops/webinars and publication of guides. And do a short training at the end of all in-country activities to summarize the process and provide guidance to NDC Hub focal point team

description.narrative: program and attendance sheet of the workshops / webinars and of the training at the end of each activity
